name: Gonzzalezz
description:
Gonzzalezz is a side-scrolling platform game from Spain. The main protagonist is a Mexican stereotype (complete with sombrero and huge mustache), that has an obsession with the traditional siesta. The game is divided in two loads:

? In the first one, Gonzalez must escape his own nightmare. He moves by executing precise jumps in one big level divided in seven sections, a surreal landscape littered with dangerous objects like flying vacuum-cleaners, disembodied hands, etc. The Q key is the jump button, while the O and P move him left and right respectively.

? In the second load, Gonzalez must find his hammock while avoiding the dangers of a stereotypical Mexican landscape (Indian tribes, wild animals, etc). Weapons and ammunition are scattered in one large level divided in sections. He can collect or drop these by crouching with the A key and can use them with the SPACE bar.
alsoFor: Amstrad CPC, Amstrad PCW, DOS, MSX | Combined View

shot.caption: The game menu screen. There's not much here. The action keys are explained, they cannot be changed, and there's the clock which shows current & high score & number of lives
The start of the game. At the bottom of the clock it shows 10 lives remaining. Current / default high score is 60,000
This is a platform game so the idea must be to jump from the start platform to the next. The green thing squirts water and the player loses a life if Gonzzalezz get wet
The geysers do shoot quite high so its essential to time these jumps well
Half a dozen jumps further on and its the end of Phase 1 and the start of Phase 2 - as denoted by the change of colour
This level is harder. The platforms are smaller and the magnets pull Gonzzalezz off them
Landing on the ground is not an option.
That slip cost a life, the number at the bottom of the clock has decreased, still the game restarts from the beginning of this section and not right at the start
